content.description:
Starts about 20 feet to the right of

Dimpled Chad

. Climb through horizontals past a bolt. Take the crack/seam that angles right and then head up past a couple more bolts. According to the topo there should be 2 fixed pitons in the seam, but we couldn't spot them from the ground. Didn't climb this one, looked sketchy.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor. Bring some super thin gear for the crack/seam, assuming one can get anything in there at all.

content.description: This route starts up the left facing flake on the right end of Super Slab. When the flake arcs left, continue straight up past a couple bolts and over a 5.7 bulge.
content.protection: Pro to 2". 3 bolts and 2 bolt anchor/rappel.

climbs.name: Dimpled Chad
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Mark Synek

content.description: Climb some horizontal cracks up and left onto a slab. Thin face moves (5.10c) past the second bolt lead to easier low-angle slab climbing. The crux may become more difficult if some loose micro-flakes break off.
content.protection: There's a horizontal that takes gear (green Metolius, or 1.5") and protects the moves to the first bolt. 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor/rappel.

content.description: This is the obvious left facing corner, near the left end of Super Slab. Both the face and the inside of the crack are sort of chossy. Belay at the sappy pine tree.
content.protection: Pro to 3". There's a couple worn slings and 1 non-locking 'biner on the tree as of April 09.

climbs.name: Cactus Challenge
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Jesse, Tucker Tech, Tim Pinar and Brett Pinar

content.description:
This route follows the obvious water-streak just right of

Keep the Worm Firm

. There's some 5.7/5.8 moves past the first couple bolts, and then very easy friction climbing all the way to the anchors. It's a fun and well protected climb on clean rock.
content.protection: Several bolts to a 2 bolt anchor/rappel.
